paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information related to the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Various ages, both male and female
patients.phenotype: Familial Amyloidotic Polyneuropathy (FAP) with varying degrees of autonomic dysfunction

individual_records.phenotype_details: Severe autonomic dysfunction with recurrent syncope.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Recurrent syncope can be the sole manifestation of TTR-FAP for a long period of time.
Some of the patients do not manifest clinically obvious autonomic symptoms, especially in the early phase of neuropathy.

functional_data.summary: Functional assays indicate that the TTR variant leads to abnormal protein folding and amyloid deposition.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families with a history of FAP.
variants.population_frequency: Rare in general population, specific frequency data not provided.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on family studies and functional assays.
variants.additional_notes: The TTR gene is associated with various phenotypes of amyloidosis, and penetrance varies significantly with age.
key_quotes: More than 100 mutations in TTR associated with amyloidosis have been described.
Phenotypic variation has been reported within the same genotype in terms of age of onset, rate of progression, and primary site of involvement.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text, focusing on the TTR gene.
